timeline.bodyText:
I would like to see a test where there is a Arg misplaced, as below, so that we define in a test how we should behave.
<Configure ...>
  <Arg>...</Arg>
  <New ...>...</New>
  <Arg>...</Arg>
</Configure>
timeline.author: sbordet

replies.bodyText:
@gregw pointed out that the Configure_9_3.dtd (and Configure_10_0.dtd) does not allow a <Arg> anywhere but the start of the element list.

  
    
      jetty.project/jetty-xml/src/main/resources/org/eclipse/jetty/xml/configure_10_0.dtd
    
    
        Lines 45 to 46
      in
      678385b
    
    
    
    

        
          
           <!ELEMENT Configure (Arg*,(%CONFIG;)*) > 
        

        
          
           <!ATTLIST Configure %IMPLIEDCLASSATTR; %IDATTR; >
replies.author: joakime

replies.bodyText: A test that is expected to fail in this scenario is dependent on the dtd used (or not used) I would think.
replies.author: joakime

replies.bodyText: Then shouldn't we do the same for Call and New? I don't think the DTD has the same enforcement for those.
replies.author: sbordet

replies.bodyText:
Opened #4658 for these new test cases.
Also <Call>

  
    
      jetty.project/jetty-xml/src/main/resources/org/eclipse/jetty/xml/configure_10_0.dtd
    
    
        Lines 168 to 169
      in
      678385b
    
    
    
    

        
          
           <!ELEMENT Call (Id?,Name?,Class?,Arg*,(%CONFIG;)*) > 
        

        
          
           <!ATTLIST Call %ARGATTR; %IMPLIEDNAMEATTR; %IMPLIEDCLASSATTR; %IDATTR; > 
        
    
  


And <New>

  
    
      jetty.project/jetty-xml/src/main/resources/org/eclipse/jetty/xml/configure_10_0.dtd
    
    
        Lines 209 to 210
      in
      678385b
    
    
    
    

        
          
           <!ELEMENT New (Id?,Name?,Class?,Arg*,(%CONFIG;)*) > 
        

        
          
           <!ATTLIST New %IDATTR; %IMPLIEDCLASSATTR; %ARGATTR; >
replies.author: joakime

replies.bodyText: Also opened #4659 for the missing Id?,Name?,Class?,Arg* in the <Configure> section on Configure_10_0.dtd
replies.author: joakime
